Public Notices
Public Notices

**DUE TO ROAD CONDITIONS AS OF WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 28, 2026, WASTE CONNECTIONS WILL NOT SERVICE EASTLAND. THEY HOPE TO BE ABLE TO MAKE UP MISSED DAYS LATER IN THE WEEK. ONCE THEY RELEASE A SCHEDULE WE WILL UPDATE HERE AS WELL AS ON OUR FACEBOOK PAGE.**

**WASTE CONNECTIONS: We would first like to thank everyone for their patience through this weather event.**

**We will be running Residential and Commercial services Thursday and Friday.**

**We will be running the Monday route for trash tomorrow and Wednesday route for trash on Friday.**

****10/23/2025: UPDATE: The Leak Has Been Repaired.                                                                                                                                                      THERE IS A WATER LEAK ON THE WEST SIDE OF EASTLAND. WATER WILL BE SHUT OFF FROM PARK HILL TO THE WEST UNTIL THE LEAK HAS BEEN REPAIRED.****

**BID NOTICE**

The City of Eastland is accepting bids for the cleanup and removal of all debris on the property located at 207 North Oak Street, excluding concrete slab. Work may not begin until October 1, 2025.

Bids should be in writing, marked “N. Oak Abatement” and delivered to 113 E. Commerce St, Eastland, TX 76448. Bids are due no later than 3 p.m. on Wednesday, September 24, 2025.

SH 112/N SEAMAN ST CROSSING TO BE CLOSED

Union Pacific Railroad will close the North Seaman (SH112) crossing at 3 a.m. on Thursday, June 5, 2025 for repairs. The crossing will be closed for approximately 24 hours.

WCTCOG Residential Safe Room Press Release

**If your garbage pick up day was changed from Friday to Thursday, and you didnt get your cart to the curb, leave it there, or put it there now. Waste Connections will make a second run VERY EARLY FRIDAY MORNING (May 9) to try and get those missed today. PLEASE SHARE WITH YOUR NEIGHBORS!**
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

**FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:                                                                                                April 4, 2025**

**FOR MORE INFORMATION**

**254-629-8321**

**CITY STORM DEBRIS CLEAN-UP DAYS SET**

Due to the recent storm, the City of Eastland will waive fees and appointments for residents who need to remove debris from their homes. On Monday, April 7 the City Convenience Center will be open 9-12 and 1-2:30 and will be accepting BRUSH ONLY. No appointments are necessary.

On Wednesday, April 9 and Friday, April 11, the Convenience Center will accept brush, trash and any wood fence materials at no charge during this time, and with an appointment. The hours will be 9:00-12 and 1-2:30

On Saturday, April 12 the Convenience Center will be open from 9 until 3 and no appointments will be required for brush and other wood debris or trash.

The Convenience Center will not accept roofing shingles, sheet rock, concrete, tires, paint or paint products, ac units, freon appliances, oils, flammable liquids or hazardous materials, automotive or engine parts, and any other construction materials.

The Convenience Center is for City of Eastland RESIDENTIAL properties with a valid City of Eastland utility account.

**A valid City of Eastland utility bill MUST be presented to dump items at the Convenience Center.**

**COMMERCIAL CLEAN-UP SERVICES MAY NOT USE THE CONVENIENCE CENTER AT ANY TIME.**

For questions on these or other City matters please stop by Eastland City Hall, 113 E Commerce St. or call during business hours at 254-629-8321.

WHEREAS, the City of Eastland on the 3rd of April, 2025, has suffered widespread or severe damage  and loss of property

WHEREAS, severe winds damaged residential, commercial and municipal structures in the City,

WHEREAS, the City of Eastland has determined that extraordinary measures must be taken to alleviate the suffering of people and to protect or rehabilitate property,

NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT PROCLAIMED BY THE Mayor of Eastland, that a local state of disaster is hereby declared for the City of Eastland pursuant to §418.108{a) of the *Texas Government Code.*

Pursuant to §418.108{b) of the *Texas Government Code,* the state of disaster shall continue for a period of not more than seven days from the date of this declaration unless continued or renewed by the Eastland City Commission.

Pursuant to §418.108(c) of the *Texas Government Code,* this declaration of a local state of disaster shall be given prompt and general publicity and shall be filed promptly with the City Secretary.

Pursuant to §418.108(d) of the *Texas Government Code,* this declaration of a local state of disaster activates the City emergency management plan.

That this proclamation shall take effect immediately from and after its issuance. ORDERED this 4thof April, 2025.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Larry Vernon, Mayor

City of Eastland

**WATER MAIN LEAK CAUSES OUTAGE EAST OF LEON RIVER**

**The City of Eastland is working a major water leak that has caused an outage to all customers east of the Leon River. All other customers are asked to curtail usage until repairs are made. 02/26/2025

WATER LINE REPLACEMENT TO CAUSE OUTAGE

**Customers listed in the areas below will be without water on Wednesday, 1/22/2025, due to a line replacement.**

**The shut down will be 4-6 hours (estimate) unless something happens that we are not expecting.**

**West Moss Street:**

The blocks of two hundred to four hundred

**North Green Street:**

The blocks of three hundred to four hundred

**North Lamar Street:**

The blocks of one hundred to three hundred

**West White Street:**

100 block of West White

**What is a Passkey?**  
Imagine signing into your account as easily as unlocking your phone—no more worrying about remembering or typing a password. A passkey is a secure digital key that uses the safety features in your device to keep your account protected. It’s designed to be both simple to use and highly secure.  
Ready to experience a simpler, safer sign-in? Click the button above to create your passkey now.
